Crimes.Legal_Issue: Violation of interim injunction by continuing unauthorized use of intellectual property
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Defendants continued decoding signals, infringing copyrights, and using trademarks post-injunction; enhanced website offerings observed
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On the plaintiffs to prove violation beyond a reasonable doubt
Crimes.Credibility_Factor: Service confirmed via email; defendants did not appear in court
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Disobedience of a court order constitutes contempt under Rule 466(b)
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Defendants failed to appear or respond to show-cause order
Crimes.Outcome_on_Merits: Defendants found in violation of court order
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Notice served via email; opportunity to respond provided
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Considered: Post-injunction activity logs, website content, service records
Crimes.Applicant_Challenge: Enforcement of interim injunction against ongoing infringement
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Digital evidence, service confirmation, operational records
Crimes.Remedy_Sought: Punitive and corrective measures for contempt
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Cited: Rule 466(b) of the Federal Courts Rules
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Unauthorized decoding, copyright and trademark infringement post-injunction
Crimes.Pending_Relief_or_Application: Website removal within five days to avoid jail sentence

Crimes.Legal_Issue: Unauthorized decoding and distribution of copyrighted material after court order
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Continued distribution of Polsat 2 programming post-injunction; use of copyrighted content
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Found guilty of contempt due to copyright infringement violation
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: Plaintiff proved violation beyond a reasonable doubt
Crimes.Credibility_Factor: Defendants did not contest allegations; evidence of ongoing activity
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Violation of court order constitutes contempt
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Failure to appear or comply with court process
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Post-injunction reproduction and distribution of protected content
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Notice properly served; procedural rights afforded
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Considered: Website operations, content availability, timing relative to injunction
Crimes.Legal_Framework: Federal Courts Rules – Contempt and IP enforcement
Crimes.Applicant_Challenge: Enforcing compliance with injunction on copyrighted works
Crimes.Court_Result: Penalties imposed including fines and conditional imprisonment
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Digital content records, service logs, infringement reports
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Cease distribution, pay fines, face potential imprisonment
Crimes.Outcome: Guilty of contempt stemming from copyright infringement
Crimes.Remedy_Sought: Injunction compliance, financial penalty, coercive sanction
Crimes.Claimant_Status: Rights holders of copyrighted television programming
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Unauthorized access and dissemination of encrypted broadcast content
Crimes.Applicable_Process: Contempt enforcement under federal procedural rules
Crimes.Pending_Relief_or_Application: Website shutdown required to suspend jail term

Crimes.Legal_Issue: Unauthorized decryption of encrypted broadcast signals in breach of court order
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Defendants actively decoded signals and expanded services post-order
Crimes.Credibility_Factor: Clear digital trail; no defense offered
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Disobeying a court order is contempt under Rule 466(b)
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Defendants failed to appear despite proper notice
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Willful continuation and enhancement of decoding activities
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Due process followed through email service and show-cause order
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Considered: Technical monitoring data, website updates, decryption tools used
Crimes.Legal_Framework: Federal Courts Rules – Contempt and IP protection
Crimes.Applicant_Challenge: Stopping ongoing technological circumvention of access controls
Crimes.Court_Result: Fines, costs, and conditional imprisonment ordered
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Electronic surveillance, server logs, expert analysis
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Immediate cessation, financial penalty, custodial sanction
Crimes.Outcome: Sanctions imposed for unlawful signal decoding
Crimes.Remedy_Sought: Compliance with injunction, deterrence through punishment
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Unauthorized decryption and redistribution of encrypted programming

Crimes.Legal_Issue: Unauthorized use of trademarked materials after court-ordered prohibition
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Defendants used plaintiffs’ trademarks post-injunction; enhanced infringing operations
Crimes.Credibility_Factor: Service confirmed; no opposition from defendants
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Disobedience of court order amounts to contempt
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Continued and amplified use of protected marks
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Considered: Use of logos, branding, domain names associated with plaintiffs
Crimes.Legal_Framework: Federal Courts Rules – Trademark and contempt enforcement
Crimes.Applicant_Challenge: Preventing misuse of brand identity after judicial order
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Brand usage records, website screenshots, trademark registrations
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Cessation of use, monetary penalty, imprisonment if non-compliant
Crimes.Outcome: Contempt finding based on trademark misuse
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Unauthorized use of trademarks in connection with pirated content delivery
Crimes.Pending_Relief_or_Application: Website removal to avoid activation of jail sentence
